column4: ok i have ubuntu 10.04 server installed. i want to do tethering with my windows mobile device.. the tethering works fine on windows computers.. buyt when i plug it into the ubuntu computer and click internet shharing... it does not connect. (i also dont get an IP address) what do i need to change?
why are you using a server for a desktop function (tethering)
then use a desktop install and remove what you want
server install is meant for server hardware
no
again , I would strongly advise you to use a desktop install base, and remove what you don't want, or use the alternative CD installer to install a cut down base install
i understand what ur sayin
why should there be a deb for windows software ?
its "windows software" it's not open source, how can debian package it ?
are there linux drivers ?
note the phrase "windows mobile phone"
1.) the server install won't have all the software needed as it's not got a desktop setup in by default 2.) is there a linux driver for your phone
is there a linux driver for your phone
where are you getting this info ?
could you please post the link ?
thanks,
look at first line
you know that's not ubuntu forums ?
the first line says nothing about ubuntu forums
have you compiled the svn version of rndis-lite
no it's not - it's svn
they are svn
ok, so what does that tell you
